text:
Fun Fact: This music is used on a TV program "Laptop si Unyil" from around 2008 to around 2014 by Trans 7. This TV station known being using JRPG musics except from Sega (maybe they have noticed if this game company was hypersensitive for copyright terms while others were busy with their businesses or Sega wasn't popular in Indonesia).

Proof? Search it at this site, the year of the program should not above around 2014.

author: Arc13

text:
Man, this game is the perfect reason why Miyamoto games should never release on time. It is still my favorite, but it could have been perfect if Miyamoto had his way and just waited a few more months. It was gonna have 3 more dungeons and another town. plus it would have had better difficulty settings.
Rule 1 of Nintendo: you do not question Miyamoto.
rule 2: you do NOT question Miyamoto.
author: Exarian

text: Being somone who sails often in real life, I'm one of the few people who can appreciate just how well simplified the sailing mechanics are in wind waker. As for the length of the sailing bits, lets just say you could sail from corner to corner three times in the time it would take to rig a boat and get it on the water.
author: Koopsas

text: @SupraDarky I hear TP get a lot of negative remarks. To me there hasn't been a single 'bad' LoZ game. Hell, there hasn't been one that was even mediocre. All of them are instant classics for me! Amazin' series.

text:
Actually added this to my ipod yesterday, along with a number of songs from Wind Waker. Sadly I was limited to 10 songs... Title, Dragon Roost, Windfall, Outset, Makar's Prayer(love the little theme), Wind Temple(very mysterious), Molgera, Sailing, Grandma(sad and touching), and the Staff Roll.
Whenever I add game songs to my ipod as you can tell, this list really does come in handy in deciding what to go with but it doesn't consume my own personal opinion. Keep it up!
